Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
CityMania::BackgroundScreenThe background screen sits behind all the other menu screens. It draws a background image that remains fixed in place regardless of whatever transitions the screens on top of it may be doing
CityMania::ButtonA popup message box screen, used to display "are you sure?" confirmation messages
protocol_pb2::Chat
chat::ChatServer
city::City
CityMania::CityManiaSample showing how to manage different game states, with transitions between menu screens, a loading screen, the game itself, and a pause menu. This main game class is extremely simple: all the interesting stuff happens in the ScreenManager component
server::ClientSocket
server::ClientSocketIRC
server::CommandProcessor
protocol_pb2::Container
CityMania::DrawSprite
engine::Entity
engine::EventManager
CityMania::GameplayScreenThis screen implements the actual game logic. It is just a placeholder to get the idea across: you'll probably want to put some more interesting gameplay in here!
CityMania::GameScreenA screen is a single layer that has update and draw logic, and which can be combined with other layers to build up a complex menu system. For instance the main menu, the options menu, the "are you sure you want to quit" message box, and the main game itself are all implemented as screens
CityMania::TEMP::GUIA screen is a single layer that has update and draw logic, and which can be combined with other layers to build up a complex menu system. For instance the main menu, the options menu, the "are you sure you want to quit" message box, and the main game itself are all implemented as screens
CityMania::InputStateHelper for reading input from keyboard and gamepad. This class tracks both the current and previous state of both input devices, and implements query methods for high level input actions such as "move up through the menu" or "pause the game"
CityMania::LoadingScreenThe loading screen coordinates transitions between the menu system and the game itself. Normally one screen will transition off at the same time as the next screen is transitioning on, but for larger transitions that can take a longer time to load their data, we want the menu system to be entirely gone before we start loading the game. This is done as follows:
main::Logger
protocol_pb2::Login
protocol_pb2::LoginResponse
CityMania::MainMenuScreenThe main menu screen is the first thing displayed when the game starts up
CityMania::MenuEntryHelper class represents a single entry in a MenuScreen. By default this just draws the entry text string, but it can be customized to display menu entries in different ways. This also provides an event that will be raised when the menu entry is selected
CityMania::MenuScreenBase class for screens that contain a menu of options. The user can move up and down to select an entry, or cancel to back out of the screen
CityMania::MessageBoxScreenA popup message box screen, used to display "are you sure?" confirmation messages
server::Network
server::NetworkIRC
CityMania::OptionsMenuScreenThe options screen is brought up over the top of the main menu screen, and gives the user a chance to configure the game in various hopefully useful ways
CityMania::PauseMenuScreenThe pause menu comes up over the top of the game, giving the player options to resume or quit
CityMania::PlayerIndexEventArgsCustom event argument which includes the index of the player who triggered the event. This is used by the MenuEntry.Selected event
region::Region
CityMania::ResourcesA strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc
CityMania::ScreenManagerThe screen manager is a component which manages one or more GameScreen instances. It maintains a stack of screens, calls their Update and Draw methods at the appropriate times, and automatically routes input to the topmost active screen
CityMania::TEMP::ScreenManagerThe screen manager is a component which manages one or more GameScreen instances. It maintains a stack of screens, calls their Update and Draw methods at the appropriate times, and automatically routes input to the topmost active screen
protocol_pb2::SelectCity
protocol_pb2::SelectCityResponse
client::ServerSocket
main::TerrainManager
main::World
